__jaccard_similarity(code_words: set[str]) → float

Calculates Jaccard similarity between two sets of words.

Args:

reference_words (set[str]): Words from the reference code. code_words (set[str]): Words from the tested code.

Returns:

float: Jaccard similarity score.

x (np.ndarray): First vector. y (np.ndarray): Second vector.

Returns:

__whitespace_analysis(code: str) → float

Calculates whitespace similarity between the reference code and the given code.

Args:

code (str): The code to compare.

Returns:

float: The whitespace similarity.

check_code(code: str, method: set[Codes.anti_plagiarism.PlagiarismChecker.PlagiarismMethod]) → set[Codes.anti_plagiarism.PlagiarismChecker.PlagiarismResult][source]

Checks for plagiarism in the given code using the specified methods.

Args:

code (str): The code to check. method (set[PlagiarismMethod]): The set of methods to use for checking.

Returns:

set[PlagiarismResult]: A set of PlagiarismResults for each method used.

Bases: Enum

Enum representing the methods used for plagiarism checking.

Attributes:

BOW: Bag of Words method. TFIDF: Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency method.

TFIDF = 2
class Codes.anti_plagiarism.PlagiarismChecker.PlagiarismResult(method: PlagiarismMethod, jaccard_similarity: float, euclidian_distance: float, cosine_similarity: float)[source]

Bases: object

Class for storing plagiarism check result.

Attributes:

method (PlagiarismMethod): The method used for checking. jaccard_similarity (float): The Jaccard similarity index. euclidian_distance (float): The Euclidian distance between document embeddings. cosine_similarity (float): The cosine similarity between document embeddings.

cosine_similarity: float
euclidian_distance: float
jaccard_similarity: float
judge_result(jaccard_threshold: float = 0.8, euclidian_threshold: float = 0.8, cosine_threshold: float = 0.8) → bool[source]

Determines whether the document is likely plagiarized based on the calculated metrics.

Args:

jaccard_threshold (float): Threshold value for the Jaccard similarity index. euclidian_threshold (float): Threshold value for the Euclidian distance. cosine_threshold (float): Threshold value for the cosine similarity.

Returns:

bool: True if any of the metrics exceed the corresponding thresholds.

method: PlagiarismMethod

Codes.anti_plagiarism.PlagiarismQueue module

class Codes.anti_plagiarism.PlagiarismQueue.PlagiarismQueue(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Queue

Represents a queue for handling plagiarism checks.

This class extends the built-in Queue class and uses threading to perform plagiarism checks in the background.

Attributes:

_instance (PlagiarismQueue): A singleton instance of the PlagiarismQueue.

_instance = <Codes.anti_plagiarism.PlagiarismQueue.PlagiarismQueue object>
cleaner() → None[source]

Cleaner thread that runs in the background and periodically adds not checked codes to queue.

This is needed because some codes may be skipped due to server malfunction. This way we can be sure that all codes will be checked.

put(item: PlagiarismQueueEntry, *args, **kwargs) → None[source]

Add a new item to the queue.

Args:

item (PlagiarismQueueEntry): The item to add to the queue.

worker() → None[source]

Worker thread that continuously checks the queue for new items.

For each item, retrieves the associated code and checks it against all other codes for plagiarism.

If an exception occurs during the plagiarism check, the error is printed and the item is marked as done.

class Codes.anti_plagiarism.PlagiarismQueue.PlagiarismQueueEntry(reference_code_id: UUID)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a queue entry for plagiarism checks.
